intro: Ivodea lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf ivy, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Ivodea lanceolata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
